Colorado_Springs.Atchison, Topeka and Santa Fe Passenger:
The Gulf, Colorado and Santa Fe Railway was a subsidiary of the Atchison, Topeka & Santa Fe Railway in eastern Texas and to Purcell, Oklahoma.


== History ==


=== 19th century ===
In 1873, there was strong competition between the cities of Houston and Galveston; and the Galveston, Houston & Henderson Railroad (GH&H) was the only rail link between the two cities. The competition between Houston and Galveston was fed by the quarantines, which were often imposed on Galveston traffic by Houston.
